title: Google\Cloud\Trace\TraceClient
name: TraceClient
description:
Google Stackdriver Trace allows you to collect latency data from your applications and display it in the Google Cloud Platform Console.

Find more information at Stackdriver Trace API docs.

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: The project ID from the Google Developer's Console.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache used storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

methods.name: insert
methods.description: Sends a Trace log in a simple fashion.

params.name: trace
params.description: The trace log to send.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

methods.name: insertBatch
methods.description: Sends multiple Trace logs in a simple fashion.

params.name: traces
params.description: The trace logs to send.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

methods.name: trace
methods.description: Lazily find or instantiates a trace. There are no network requests made at this point. To see the operations that can be performed on a trace please see Google\Cloud\Trace\Trace. If no traceId is provided, one will be generated for you.

params.name: traceId
params.description: The trace id of the trace to reference.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: options.viewType
params.description: Type of data returned for traces in the list. Can be one of 'VIEW_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED', 'MINIMAL', 'ROOTSPAN', or 'COMPLETE'

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: Maximum number of traces to return per page.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: Token identifying the page of results to return

params.name: options.startTime
params.description: Start of the time interval during which trace data was collected. This timestamp in nanoseconds should be in "Zulu" format. Example: '2014-10-02T15:01:23.045123456Z'

params.name: options.endTime
params.description: End of the time interval during which trace data was collected. This timestamp in nanoseconds should be in "Zulu" format. Example: '2014-10-02T15:01:23.045123456Z'

params.name: options.filter
params.description: An optional filter for the request

params.name: options.orderBy
params.description: Field used to sort the returned traces. Can be one of 'traceId', 'name', 'duration', 'start'. Descending order can be specified by appending 'desc' to the sort field (for example, 'name desc'). Only one sort field is permitted.

methods.name: reporter
methods.description: Return a Trace reporter that utilizes this client's configuration

params.name: options
params.description: Reporter options. Google\Cloud\Trace\Reporter\AsyncReporter::__construct()
